item.description:
Please invite a gentleman you know.

Costumes are optional. Although it was great fun to see the variety of costumes last year.

Best of both worlds. There is a separate quiet room available 30' x 20' isolated from the dance floor if you want to talk privately with your new friends.

Our energy will soar again!

There is someone out there that is our perfect match. When they see you or me they will say you’re perfect. Your gorgeous.
Women, when a man sees you, he will stumble on his words or forget what to say because you have dazzled him. Have patience they will recover and make sense.

Values of this group: To be nice, kind, cheerful, friendly and to be respectful to everyone. We utilize private dance parties as a vehicle to meet other singles. Purpose is to socialize with similar people of our age (30-65) who are searching for a lifetime partner. Have fun meeting old and new friends. Circulate, talk to everyone. If someone is alone go up to them and say hi! Please be Friendly, Positive, and optimistic to everyone.

This is a Yes Dance - I ask you to be respectful and say yes to anyone who asks you to dance once. Please understand this is our number one value. If you are able to say yes, then this is a great event for you to attend.

Please invite other friends, particularly men. Our objective is to have an equal amount of men and women. We are very close on equal numbers of men and women.

The synergistic efforts of everyone will make it truly a memorable dance party.

***The entry fee is $15.00 plus wine or food assignment listed below. Pay at door.
Of course if you are unable to bring anything, then your entry fee will be $30.00.

Organizer/Host - Richard Tosti

Location is in a warm, loving and relaxing environment.
"Dress code - "professional casual
7:30PM - 11:00pm
Sat. Oct. 30, 2010
Temple Shalom Emeth, 16 Lexington Street, Burlington, MA
Maximum attendees 90
Dancing will be available - DJ

No pork or shellfish

Pizza Buffet which will start at 8:30PM
Appetizers served at 7:45PM
Open Bar - wine/beer

If your last name begins with the following letter please bring the following. Pizza, wine or dessert.
These are the correct assignments for this party.

A THROUGH C - Wine (Minimum of $10)
D THROUGH N - Pizza (large size)
O THROUGH S - Desserts (pies, apple, blueberry, lemon meringue), your favorite, cakes, (no cookies)
T THROUGH Z - Healthy appetizers (Salad) or 4 bottles of soda/One gallon water

Location and Directions
Temple Shalom Emeth, 16 Lexington Street, Burlington, MA

128 North
Exit 32B Middlesex Turnpike (Burlington/Arlington)
At the end of the ramp turn right onto Middlesex Turnpike - on the left is Barnes/Noble
After the Burlington Mall turn right on to Burlington Mall Rd. - on left is Longs Jewelers
Take left after you pass Kohl’s on your left which is Lexington Street
Temple Shalom Emeth is on your left at16 Lexington Street, Burlington, MA

There are two parking lots on the right side of building. Enter through the side entrance at the end of the building. Third parking lot is two houses up at Church - we have permission. Fourth parking lot is across the street - McGinnis Ave., - Mt Hope Church.

See you on Saturday, Oct. 30, at 7:30pm----

7:30pm Party begins
Food served at 8:00

The best is yet to be!
Richard Tosti
item.how_to_find_us: Welcome you at the door with a Sincere, Friendly Smile!
item.name: Halloween Singles Dance Party 30-65
